title: Islander: I'll bring refugees into my house
text:
James Andrews lives in a small one bedroom flat in St Helier.
However, he says he would be happy to make space for a spare bed for a refugee.
He says seeing upsetting scenes of 'fantastic' cities reduced to rubble by war makes him empathise with the refugees.
'Anybody' could be a refugee he says, and a 'degree of compassion' is needed.
Play video This comes after a packed out town hall in Jersey held a public debate about taking refugees in yesterday, where there were many opposing views.
One woman who does not feel the same as James is Mandy Bisson.
She's is concerned about refugees coming to the island and moving into social housing, when there are local people on the housing list.
Mandy is also worried that they won't speak English and their children will put a strain on Jersey's education system.
Helping in alternative ways, such as sending money abroad, is a better way to help she says.
And when accused of having a racist viewpoint, she points out that Jersey has welcomed many cultures before and islanders are kind, but she thinks they need "a break".
Play video Jersey has so far sent a million pounds overseas to help the refugees fleeing Syria.
The States are talking to the UK Home Office to see if taking refugees into Jersey will be possible.
Last updated Thu 8 Oct 2015 Politics Jersey
